original: Holmberg, Knut Hjalmar, redaktionssekreterare, Göteborg, f. 9/1/86 i Sthlm av Johan H. o. Kristina Tvär-ling. G. 16 m. Serla Ström. Barn: Eva f. 18, g. m. apot. Inge Ehrlén, Sthlm, Nils- Erik 21, anst. v. Esselte, Gbg. — Mog:ex. v. Fjellstedtska sk. i Upps. ’08, stud. v. Sthlms högsk. 08. Medarb. i Sv. Notisbyrån 08-09, Sthlms-Tidn. 09-10 o. 13-28, Aftontidn. 10-11, Dagen 11-13, andre red. i Af-tombl. 20-32; red:chief o. ansv. utg. i Morgontidn. i Gbg 36, red :sekr. i Gbgs Hand:- o. Sjöfartstidn. sed. 39. Medl. av Publ:kl. sed. 09, led. av diesis styr. 29-33i ’S’ekr. i Sv. journ :föa-€n. Sthtas-krets^ 15-16, ordf. 3a-36, suppl. i nd(n f. statens journ :stip. 19. Sign.: Håge.
translated: Holmberg, Knut Hjalmar, editorial secretary, Gothenburg, born January 9, 1886 in Stockholm to Johan H. and Kristina Tvär-ling. Married to Serla Ström in 1916. Children: Eva, born in 1918, married to pharmacist Inge Ehrlén in Stockholm, Nils-Erik, 21 years old, employed by Esselte in Gothenburg. Holmberg graduated from Fjellstedtska school in Uppsala in 1908 and studied at Stockholm University in 1908. He worked as a contributor for the Swedish Notisbyrån from 1908-1909, Stockholm-Tidn. from 1909-1910 and 1913-1928, Aftontidn. from 1910-1911, Dagen from 1911-1913, and was second editor at Aftonbladet from 1920-1932. He served as chief editor and responsible publisher at Morgontidn. in Gothenburg in 1936 and editorial secretary at Gothenburg's Trade and Shipping Journal since 1939. Holmberg became a member of the Publicist Club in 1909 and a member of the Diocese board from 1929-1933. He was the secretary in the Swedish Journalist Association's State Branch from 1915-1916, chairman from 1933-1936, a substitute in the foundation of the state journal scholarship in 1919. Holmberg's signature is Håge.
